rucOatGiZACgXZXyZHFOEg.text: We arrived in Edinburgh on a Sunday and slept til the evening - when this was the only place we could find walking distance that was open! We did not have a reservation so they were kind enough to allow us to order take out. The food was amazing, hands down some of the best thai food I have ever eaten. We loved it so much, we came here twice during our week long stay in Scotland!

xaFikMU045M58YFHDhz0Zw.text: We had been sampling Thai food throughout the UK. Nok's Kitchen was solid - not a blow you away experience. We started with the crab curry "cones" and chicken roll. Chicken roll was dry - needed a bit of sauce. Crab "cones" were probably the best dish of the meal with seafood flavor backed by a nice curry flavor. For mains we split the panang curry (red) and soft shell crab curry (yellow). Both were solid - panang maybe a bit too much coconut milk mellowed out the flavor. Both didn't have a ton of depth and for 3 pounds would expect more rice because one wasn't enough to split. Good serve and overall experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Nok's Kitchen - Stockbridge, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Crab and chicken rolls
Photo of Nok's Kitchen - Stockbridge, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Soft shell crab curry
Photo of Nok's Kitchen - Stockbridge, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

6Z0S2KvRq4zi0c3U95kthA.text: We stopped in here after walking all around the city all day, and as our first day in Edinburgh had no idea you had to have reservations before you could think about eating dinner anywhere.  They said if we ate within the hour we could stay, SOLD!  Such tasty food, small place, friendly staff.  We had pad thai and a curry.  It was so good, especially after our long day out, really hit the spot.  Would recommend this place to anyone visiting Stockbridge- but make a reservation!

hDiudFGDyCuF_7o1iprM5w.text: Prawn phad thai, contained 4 prawns, too few for the amount of noodles, and was very greasy. Peanut topping very chunky and sparse. Overall, not impressed at all. Veg spring rolls, small, bland with store grade chilli dipping sauce. Chilli chicken was very battered and greasy also. Overall a fail. Will not be back.

Up6-YlH_W4f0dzLPNScevw.text: Arrived to a yummy late lunch of noodles and chicken in a spicy broth  with a side of spring rolls and chai. Great pick me up after long walking day. Prices and service great! Love the stylish feel to this small jewel.

PKjIISkFtBnMQZCQM6X8tg.text: Really great Thai food and service. We walked in and they seated us even though their reservations kept them full up. Loved the Panay Currie, Cashew chicken and the Mossamon Currie.

NLxHeeU6x88fJwSgcJ3mXQ.text: If there was ever a reason to go back to Edinburgh, aside from the obvious fact that it's absolutely gorgeous there, it would be hands down to eat at Nok's again. One of the best Tom Kha (coconut soup) and Tom Yum (hot & sour soup) I've ever had in my short life. It's unfortunate that I didn't get to try more, but on a cold windy and rainy night, those soups saved my life... I'm still craving/thinking about it three weeks later!  FYI - make a reservation, no matter the party size. The restaurant is average size but it gets packed really quick and there isn't exactly a waiting area.

kklH4UVraSe0K0bI-CIx8g.text: It was late at night and they were super crowded, so we ordered takeaway. The food was absolutely delicious! I will definitely eat here on my next trip to Edinburgh.

IVG7BSMGS4p5QT1wp4Lzgw.text: The best Thai food I think I have ever eaten. This cozy, busy place is worth making a reservation.

IaKovNlWdPn6clrbCAjcQg.text: Awesome Thai food! Had the pad Thai and cashew chicken. Both were very good and the service was good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Nok's Kitchen - Stockbridge, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken pad Thai. Very good. Noodles were a little chewy but would get again. Good flavor!
Photo of Nok's Kitchen - Stockbridge, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cashew chicken. Must get!
